The security situation has been volatile with areas at and around Donetsk airport sometimes registering no ceasefire violations for several days, while Horlivka has seen a marked increase in violence, including the use of mortars and Multiple Launch Rocket Systems (MLRS). The Pavlopil-Oktiabr-Kominternove triangle, where previously the sides had been repositioning and deploying, now also shows signs of escalation. Luhansk region remains relatively calm.

The Principal Deputy Chief Monitor of the OSCE Special Monitoring Mission (SMM) Alexander Hug will travel to eastern Ukraine from 14 to 18 January 2016 to assess the security situation and open new Forward Patrol Bases. More at: www.osce.org/ukraine-smm/215241
